BANKING GENERAL KNOWLEDGE

for IBPS, RBI, SBI, NABARD and other Bank Examinations

[SOURCES]
The Bank of Bombay (15 April 1840) and the Bank of Madras (1 July 1843) followed the Bank of Bengal. These three banks remained at the apex of modern banking in India till their amalgamation as the Imperial Bank of India on 27 January

(A) 1961

(B) 1956

(C) 1949

(D) ** 1921

EXPLANATIONS BELOW

Concept note-1: -The 3 banks Bank of Bengal, the Bank of Bombay and Bank of Madras were merged in 1921 to form the “Imperial Bank of India”. It acted as Central Bank of India (or) Quasi-central bank till the establishment of RBI in 1935. After India’s independence, Imperial Bank of India became the State Bank of India in 1955.

Concept note-2: -The three Presidency Banks were at the helm of Indian banking till their amalgamation in 1921 into the Imperial Bank of India, which combined the role of a commercial bank and a central bank.

Concept note-3: -The Presidency Banks were the Bank of Bengal, established on 2 June 1806, the Bank of Bombay (incorporated on 15 April 1840), and the Bank of Madras (incorporated on 1 July 1843). The Imperial Bank was 80% privately owned while the rest were owned by the state.

Concept note-4: -– In 1921 these three banks (Bengal, Bombay, and Madras) combined, and a new bank was formed, Imperial Bank of India.

Try yourself to solve below questions:

CONCEPT QUESTION- 1 :

Which Bank was formed after the merger of the Bank of Madras Bank of Calcutta and Bank of Bombay?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 2 :

Which Bank came into existence in 1921 when three presidency banks merged Bank of Bombay Bank of Bangal and Bank of Madras?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 3 :

Which banks were generally called Bank of Bengal Bank of Bombay and Bank of Madras?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 4 :

Which Bank came into existence in the year 1921 when three banks namely Bank of Bengal 1806 Bank of Bombay?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 5 :

Which first modern bank in tamilnadu was started by british in 1843?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 6 :

Which was the earliest bank in India that was established in 1770 and went into liquidation in 1832?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 7 :

Which company established Bank of Bengal Bank of Bombay and Bank of Madras?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 8 :

Which branch bank was established in Madras in the year 1843?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 9 :

Which bank established in 1843?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 10 :

Which of these banks was set up on 15 August 1907 as a result of the Swadeshi movement?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 11 :

Which banks are amalgamated into the Imperial Bank of India in 1921 by a special act?

CONCEPT QUESTION- 12 :

Which of the following was the first commercial bank established by Indians in 1881?
